lead_paragraph: The government is trying to reassure citizens while the Taliban appears to be trying to strengthen its hand before peace talks.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Najim Rahim from Kunduz, and Rod Nordland from Kabul.
byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL and AHMAD SHAKIB

headline.print_headline: Taliban Step Up Urban Assaults, Testing the Mettle of Afghan Forces
headline.main: Taliban Step Up Urban Assaults, Testing the Mettle of Afghan Forces

snippet: The government is trying to reassure citizens while the Taliban appears to be trying to strengthen its hand before peace talks.
abstract: Taliban is attempting to complement its provincial gains by reasserting itself in Afghan cities with guerrilla attacks, but Afghan security forces have been able to repel many of them successfully; attacks symbolize both Taliban's attempts to strengthen its standing before peace talks and Afghanistan government's efforts to calm its citizens.
